value.title: Air Canada to layoff 15,000 staff due to coronavirus: internal memo
value.excerpt: Air Canada will move ahead with plans to layoff 15,000 staff due to the coronavirus pandemic. value.title: Coronavirus Measures Ramp Up In Japan Following Postponement Of 2020 Tokyo Olympics
value.excerpt: Japan has avoided strict coronavirus measures for weeks as much of the world locks down. But with the postponement of the 2020 Olympics and a sudden spike in Tokyo COVID-19 cases, that appears to be changing.

value.title: How to Apply for Unemployment in North Dakota

value.title: New York Hospitals Plan Coordination as Coronavirus Deaths in State Top 1,200
value.excerpt: A U.S. Navy hospital ship arrived in New York City on Monday to help alleviate the strain of the coronavirus crisis on local hospitals, as Gov. Andrew Cuomo outlined a new statewide plan to coordinate medical care for the infected.

value.title: Coronavirus live updates: Wimbledon will reportedly be canceled; Celtics' Marcus Smart recovers from COVID-19
value.excerpt: As of Wednesday evening, there have been at least 454,000 confirmed coronavirus cases worldwide, according to CBS News, and more than 20,000 people have died due to the virus. In addition, multiple states are under a state of emergency politicians from the local to federal level along with public health officials are recommending large gatherings of people -- including sporting events -- in coronavirus hotspots be canceled or closed to the public.

value.title: U.S. Coronavirus Cases Hit 150,000, Nearly Double China's Total Infections
value.excerpt: Confirmed coronavirus cases in the U.S. have climbed past 153,200, with a death toll of over 2,800, while around 5,000 have recovered from infection, according to the latest figures from Johns Hopkins University. The virus, which was first reported in Wuhan, a city in China's Hubei province, has infected over 766,300 people globally across 177 ...

value.title: OHA: 58 new coronavirus cases; 3 new deaths
value.excerpt: SALEM, Ore. -- On Monday, the Oregon Health Authority announced three new deaths linked to coronavirus and 58 new cases. Four of the new cases are in Douglas County, two are in Lane County, and one is in Benton County. One of the deaths was a 91-year-old veteran at the veterans' home in Lebanon. He tested positive March 15 and died on Sunday.

value.title: Gov. Mike DeWine extends Ohio school closure until May 1 because of coronavirus
value.excerpt: CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Gov. Mike DeWine on Monday extended in-person K-12 school closures through May 1 because of the coronavirus crisis. DeWine on March 12 had called for a three-week “spring break,” starting March 16. Since then, Ohio students have been learning online. During his statehouse news briefing Monday DeWine thanked teachers and ...

value.title: DeWine extends K-12 school closures amid coronavirus pandemic
value.excerpt: Ohio’s K-12 schools will be closed for longer than initially planned as the coronavirus pandemic continues, Gov. Mike DeWine announced Monday. Schools will be closed through Friday, May 1, he said, meaning virtual instruction will take place at least through then.
